intro: Limonium dodartii subsp. lusitanicum, commonly known as the Lusitanian sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in dune environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in maritime climates.
